graph_title: Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training
indicator_name: Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training
methodology_global: This proportion of youth (aged 15-24 years) not in education, employment or training, also known as 'the NEET rate', conveys the number of young persons not in education, employment or training as a percentage of the total youth population. Computation Method: The indicator is calculated as follows: NEET rate = (Youth - Youth in employment - Youth not in employment but in education or training) / Youth*100
SDG_GOAL: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
SDG_TARGET: By 2020, substantially reduce the proportion of youth not in employment, education or training
SDG_INDICATOR: Proportion of youth (aged 15–24 years) not in education, employment or training
